thread.section_title: NWAonline stories: High School Sports - Northwest Arkansas
thread.title: Maertens too much for Wolves

title: Maertens too much for Wolves
text:
Maertens too much for Wolves By Phil Skaggs Posted: October 24, 2015 at 2:10 a.m. 
BENTON -- Cason Maertens looked sharp on a rainy night. 
Maertens passed for 332 yards and three touchdowns in his second start since recovering from a knee injury to lead Benton to a 31-9 victory over Lake Hamilton on Friday night. 
Maertens, who sneaked in for a third-quarter score for a 24-3 lead, capped his big night with a 73-yard touchdown pass to running back Brandon Hunter with 8:12 to play. Maertens finished 24 of 29, while Drew Dyer led Benton's receivers with 10 catches for 112 yards. 
" I thought we executed well," Benton Coach Scott Neathery said. "Our quarterback's percentage was good. Twenty-four for twenty-nine, I'll take that." 
Hunter led the Panthers with 124 yards on 16 carries and had 99 yards on 4 catches. Colton Nix had 76 yards and 1 touchdown on 7 catches. 
Johnathan Buss led Lake Hamilton with 121 yards on 27 carries. 
The Wolves managed a 44-yard filed goal by Ethan Johnson on their first possession but didn't score again until fullback Eli Jackson scored from the 4 with 4:37 to play. 
Maertens came out hot, completing 7 of 9 passes while guiding Benton to touchdowns on its first two possessions. He hit Nix with perfectly thrown 21-yard touchdown pass 1:27 seconds into the game, and his second TD toss covered 29 yards to Dyer on a skinny post route with 4:25 left in the quarter. 
Lake Hamilton's offense limited the Panthers' chances by driving 30 yards after Ramar Easter's 25-yard kickoff return before settling for Johnson's field goal between Benton's touchdowns. Jackson ran 11 yards for a first down and quarterback Bryce Briggs raced for 14 yards on the next play before the drive stalled. 
Sports on 10/24/2015
